properties.Name: ShippingLocationPartyRelationshipType
properties.Description:
The nature of the relationship between a shipping location and party for the associated period of time.

The one or more roles, functions or responsibilities that the associated Party may perform at the associated Location during the period indicated.

Ex:
- Agent
- Beneficial Cargo Owner
- Broker
- Cargo Agent
- Cartage Agent
- Co-Loader 
- Consignee 
- Consignor 
- Consolidator 
- Courier 
- Customhouse Broker
- Dealer
- Export Broker
- Export Jobber
- Freight Forwarder
- Master Loader
- Purchasing Agent

where:

AGENT 
An agent who distributes, represents, services or sells goods on behalf of sellers.
A person authorized to transact business for, and in the name of, another person or company.
A forwarder, agent or broker who is recognized and approved by IATA, appointed by a carrier and authorized by the respective carrier to receive and prepare shipments and to collect charges. See Cargo Sales Agent.
Agent (Agt.)
A person authorized to transact business for and in the name of another person or company. Types of agent are:
(1) brokers,
(2) commission merchants,
(3) resident buyers,
(4) sales agents,
(5) manufacturer's representatives.

BENEFICIAL CARGO OWNER
Abbreviation for "Beneficial Cargo Owner." Refers to the importer of record, who physically takes possession of cargo at destination and does not act as a third party in the movement of such goods.

BROKER
One that acts as an agent for others, as in negotiating contracts, purchases, or sales in return for a fee or commission.

CARGO AGENT
An agent appointed by an airline to solicit and process international air freight for shipments.  Cargo agents are paid commissions by the airline.

An agent appointed by IATA to solicit and process international cargo for shippers. IATA Cargo Sales Agents are paid commissions by the airlines without added cost to the shipper or consignee. See Agent IATA

CARTAGE AGENT
Ground service operator who provides pickup and delivery in areas not served directly by air carrier.

Ground service operator who provides pick-up and delivery in areas not served directly by air carrier.

CO-LOADER
A co-loader participates in a consolidation but is not the master loader.

Each co-loader provides all the documentation required for their shipment to the master loader.

CONSIGNEE
The person or firm named in a freight contract to whom goods have been shipped or turned over for care.

CONSIGNOR
The entity that ships goods to another.

CONSOLIDATOR
An entity that provides consolidation services, joining multiple shipments into a single shipment for tender to an air carrier.

An entity that provides service also provided by an air carrier, independent from that carrier, and derives income from package consolidation of others for tender to an air carrier.

An Air Freight Forwarder performs the function of a consolidator.

COURIER
Attendant who accompanies shipments.

Express company which handles shipments of documents and small packages on an expedited basis and may or may not have the shipments accompanied by attendants.

CUSTOMHOUSE BROKER
Any person who is licensed in accordance with Part III of Title 19 of the US Code of US Federal Regulations to transact Customs business on the behalf of others.

A broker who is certified by the U.S. Bureau of Customs to act for importers and other businessmen in handling the sequence of Customs formalities and other Retails related to the legal importation of goods.

CUSTOMHOUSE BROKER
A person or firm, licensed by the treasury department of their country when required, engaged in entering and clearing goods through Customs for a client (importer).

CUSTOMHOUSE BROKER
Any person who is licensed in accordance with Part III of Title 19 of the US Code of US Federal Regulations to transact Customs business on the behalf of others.

A broker who is certified by the U.S. Bureau of Customs to act for importers and other businessmen in handling the sequence of Customs formalities and other details related to the legal importation of goods.

DEALER
A foreign-based business agent acting as an intermediary between a foreign exported and a homemarket importer.

EXPORT BROKER
A firm that specializes in bringing foreign buyers and domestic sellers together for a fee but usually does not participate in the actual business transaction.

EXPORT JOBBER
Domestic international middlemen who handle mostly bulky products and raw materials, but do not take physical control of them.

FREIGHT FORWARDER
An agent that handles the routing and shipment and freight.

Ex:
Air Freight Forwarder is Service organization which serves the dual role of air carrier (usually indirect) and shipper.  To the shipper the air freight forwarder is an indirect air carrier because it receives freight under its own tariff, yet does not actually operate the airplanes.  The air freight forwarder provides pick-up and delivery service to and from the shippers dock, consolidates shipments into larger units, prepares shipping documentation and tenders shipments to the airlines.  To the airlines, the air freight forwarder is a shipper.  Ordinarily an air freight forwarder is classed as an indirect air carrier, however, some air freight forwarders operate their own aircraft.

MASTER LOADER
The IATA agent who assumes the responsibility for contracting with other agents to assemble goods for consolidation to the airlines.

PURCHASING AGENT
An agent who purchases goods in their own country on behalf of foreign buyers such as government agencies or private businesses.

Columns.Name: ShippingLocationPartyRelationshipTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Shipping Location Party Relationship Type.

Columns.Name: ShippingLocationPartyRelationshipTypeName
Columns.Description: The name of a Shipping Location Party Relationship Type.

Columns.Name: ShippingLocationPartyRelationshipTypeDescription
Columns.Description: The description of a Shipping Location Party Relationship Type.
